text: effective July 31st I will be stepping
down as majority leader with that the
kickoff of a campaign pitting
establishment Republicans against the
Tea Party in leadership elections
scheduled for next Thursday here's who
to watch now on the New York Times
minute the current House leadership
looks like this
there's the Speaker John Boehner his
deputy is Majority Leader Eric Cantor
until July next on the totem pole is
Majority Whip Kevin McCarthy with Cantor
out mr. McCarthy with his relatively
moderate record wants to move up and
he's a clear front-runner to do so he
could face some competition from Idaho
Representative Raul Labrador
but perhaps the more interesting race
will be for whip Peter Roskam a moderate
from Illinois will be the establishment
candidate presuming McCarthy vacants the
Tea Party will have two standard bearers
the first is Louisiana's Steve Scalise
with a 100 percent rating from the
American Conservative Union Indiana's
Marlin Stutzman is another contender
with a conservative rating nearly as
high it's important we resolve this
issue in a fair amount of time so that
we can do the work that we were elected
to do now if both McCarthy and Ross can
prevail it would actually make the
Republican leadership more moderate than
it is now this while mr. Cantor surprise
defeat could spook rank-and-file
Republicans away from compromise
especially on immigration all in all
expect even more gridlock on Capitol
Hill not that many were expecting
significant legislation this year anyway
